title: (x) Elegant serif text face - H&FJ Requiem {Yves}
content:
I feel like I should know this, but everything I thought it was...wasn’t. Can anyone help? It appears the bowl of the lc “P” extends back past the vertical. I’m stumped.

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20070831193904im_/http:/typophile.com/files/back2_3828.gif)

 [‹ The Cinematics blocky old school display face](http://web.archive.org/web/20070831193904/http:/typophile.com/node/35891 "Go to previous forum topic") [(x) Bella Frutta metal face with angled terminals on 'a' nd 'r' - Runic Condensed {Yves} ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20070831193904/http:/typophile.com/node/35957 "Go to next forum topic")
author: Tonie Blaze

comments.content: I just tried it on your suggestion, but the “h” is different and the cap to lower case height relationship is off as well. Thanks, though.
Yeah it’s a Jenson for sure. Seems to actually match Adobe better.
I agree. I think it’s closer to Adobe. I knew it was a Jenson, but didn’t have time for the comparison!

This is [Hoefler & Frere-Jones](http://web.archive.org/web/20070831193904/http:/typophile.com/wiki/Hoefler%252B%252526%252BFrere-Jones)’ [Requiem](http://web.archive.org/web/20070831193904/http:/www.typography.com/catalog/requiem/testdriver/index.html).

Sorry it took me so long to get to your thread, but I’m still catching up after yesterday’s flood of new ID requests. I’m now going backwards through some 100+ threads to tie up any loose ends.
Uh Oh, will I be banned for mistaking an Arrighi for a Jenson? :)
You, Sir, will have your [pantaloons set on fire](http://web.archive.org/web/20070831193904/http:/www.trouserfire.com/) for that! :^P
